reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act
reg:regulation.reg:title: Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 223/2015, January 18, 2016]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The form set out in Schedule A is prescribed as the Information to Obtain a Search Warrant for the purposes of section 26 (2) (b) of the Act.
The form set out in Schedule B is prescribed as the Warrant to Search for the purposes of section 26 (2) (b) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who files, under section 20.3 of the Act, a notice of appeal with the board must include with the notice of appeal a fee of $100.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, blind person, dog trainer, dog-in-training, dog-in-training team, guide dog, guide dog team, person with a disability, service dog and service dog team have the same meaning as in the Guide Dog and Service Dog Act.
An animal is prescribed as a service animal for the purposes of the Act if the animal is used as one of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: as a guide dog by a blind person as part of a guide dog team;
as a service dog by a person with a disability as part of a service dog team;
as a dog-in-training by a dog trainer as part of a dog-in-training team.

bcl:centertext.in:strong: Information to Obtain a Search Warrant
Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act (the "Act")

bcl:schedule.bcl:lefttext:
The informant says that the informant has reasonable grounds to believe that —
[check as applicable]
bcl:schedule.bcl:indent1: [ ] an animal is in distress in/at ....................................................................... [specify premises, vehicle, aircraft, vessel] (the "premises");

[ ] an offence under section 24 of the Act has been committed, namely............................[describe the offence in respect of which the search is to be made], and that there are in/at ......................................................[specify premises, vehicle, aircraft, vessel] (the "premises") things, including.............................................................................[describe things to be searched for] (the "things described"), that will afford evidence of that offence.
bcl:schedule.bcl:lefttext:
The informant asks that a warrant be issued authorizing an authorized agent of the British Columbia Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals or, if applicable, a peace officer in the Province of British Columbia exercising the powers of an authorized agent under section 22 of the Act, to enter the premises —
[check as applicable]
bcl:schedule.bcl:indent1: [ ] to take any action authorized by the Act to relieve the animal's distress;
[ ] to search for and seize the things described.
bcl:schedule.bcl:lefttext:
........................................................................................
A Judge or Justice of the Peace in and for
the Province of British Columbia

bcl:centertext.in:strong: Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act (the "Act")

bcl:schedule.bcl:lefttext: To an authorized agent of the British Columbia Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals or, if applicable, to a peace officer in the Province of British Columbia exercising the powers of an authorized agent under section 22 of the Act:

I am satisfied, on the sworn/affirmed information of ................................................................, of ........................................., British Columbia that there are reasonable grounds to believe that —
[check as applicable]
bcl:schedule.bcl:indent1: [ ] an animal is in distress in/at ....................................................................... [specify premises, vehicle, aircraft, vessel] (the "premises");

[ ] an offence under section 24 of the Act has been committed, namely .............................[describe the offence in respect of which the search is to be made], and that there are in/at .........................................................[specify premises, vehicle, aircraft, vessel to be searched] (the "premises") the following things that will afford evidence of that offence: ................................ [describe things to be searched for] (the "things described").
bcl:schedule.bcl:lefttext:
This authorizes you to enter the premises —
[check as applicable]
bcl:schedule.bcl:indent1: [ ] to determine whether any action authorized by the Act should be taken to relieve the animal's distress and to take such action;
[ ] to search for and seize the things described.
bcl:schedule.bcl:lefttext:
...........................................................
A Judge or Justice of the Peace in and for
the Province of British Columbia
